entry.title: MongoDB rename databases
entry.content:
The â€œcopydbâ€ command is deprecated, please use these two commands instead:

  1. mongodump to back up data
  2. mongorestore to recover data from mongodump into a new namespace

ä¸èµæˆä½¿ç”¨copyå‘½ä»¤ï¼Œè¯·ä½¿ç”¨ä»¥ä¸‹ä¸¤ä¸ªå‘½ä»¤æ¥ä»£æ›¿ï¼š

  1. mongodumpå¤‡ä»½æ•°æ®
  2. mongorestoreä»mongodumpçš„æ•°æ®æ¢å¤åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„å‘½åç©ºé—´

We are aware of how painful and long it is to rename a database in MongoDB. Unfortunately, this is not an simple feature for us to implement due to the way that database metadata is stored in the original (default) storage engine. In MMAPv1 files, the namespace (e.g.: dbName.collection) that describes every single collection and index includes the database name, so to rename a set of database files, every single namespace string would have to be rewritten. This impacts:

  • the .ns file
  • every single numbered file for the collection
  • the namespace for every index
  • internal unique names of each collection and index
  • contents of system.namespaces and system.indexes (or their equivalents in the future)
  • other locations I may be missing

æˆ‘ä»¬æ¸…æ¥šåœ¨MongoDBé‡å‘½åä¸€ä¸ªæ•°æ®åº“æœ‰å¤šç—›è‹¦å’Œè¦å¤šä¹…ã€‚å¾ˆä¸å¹¸å› ä¸ºæ•°æ®åº“å…ƒæ•°æ®çš„å­˜å‚¨æ–¹å¼ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ç§ç®€å•çš„å®ç°æ–¹å¼ã€‚åœ¨MMAPv1æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­ï¼Œå‘½åç©ºé—´æè¿°æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆã€ç´¢å¼•å’Œæ•°æ®åº“çš„åç§°ï¼Œå› æ­¤ä¸ºäº†ä¿®æ”¹ä¸€ç³»åˆ—æ•°æ®åº“æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªåå­—ç©ºé—´å­—ç¬¦ä¸²éƒ½è¦è¢«ä¿®æ”¹ã€‚è¿™å½±å“åˆ°ï¼š

  • .nsæ–‡ä»¶

  • é›†åˆçš„æ¯ä¸ªç¼–å·æ–‡ä»¶

  • æ¯ä¸ªé›†åˆå’Œç´¢å¼•çš„å†…éƒ¨å”¯ä¸€å‘½å
  • system.namespaceå’Œsystem.indexesçš„å†…å®¹
  • å…¶ä»–æˆ‘å¯èƒ½é—æ¼çš„åœ°æ–¹

This is just to accomplish a rename of a single database in a standalone mongod instance. For replica sets the above would need to be done on every replica node, plus on each node every single oplog entry that refers this database would have to be somehow invalidated or rewritten, and then if itâ€™s a sharded cluster, one also needs to add these changes to every shard if the DB is sharded, plus the config servers have all the shard metadata in terms of namespaces with their full names.

è¿™åªæ˜¯å®Œæˆå•ä¸€mongodå®ä¾‹çš„æ•°æ®åº“é‡å‘½åã€‚å‰¯æœ¬é›†éœ€è¦åœ¨æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸Šåšä¸€éä»¥ä¸Šæ“ä½œï¼Œå¦å¤–æ¯ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸Šçš„æ¯ä¸ªç”¨åˆ°è¿™ä¸ªåº“çš„oplogæ¡ç›®éƒ½ä¼šå˜æ— æ•ˆæˆ–éœ€è¦é‡å†™ã€‚è€Œå¯¹äºåˆ†ç‰‡é›†ç¾¤ï¼Œè¦å¯¹è¿™ä¸ªæ•°æ®åº“çš„æ¯ä¸ªåˆ†ç‰‡éƒ½åŠ ä¸Šè¿™äº›ä¿®æ”¹ï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬å«æœ‰æ‰€æœ‰æ•°æ®åº“å®Œæ•´åç§°çš„åˆ†ç‰‡å…ƒæ•°æ®çš„é…ç½®æœåŠ¡å™¨ã€‚

There would be absolutely no way to do this on a live system. To do it offline, it would require re-writing every single database file to accommodate the new name, and at that point it would be as slow as the current â€œcopydbâ€ command.

è¿™å®åœ¨æ— æ³•åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªåœ¨çº¿ç³»ç»Ÿä¸Šå®ç°ã€‚

ç¦»çº¿åšçš„è¯ï¼Œè¿™éœ€è¦é‡å†™æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ•°æ®åº“æ–‡ä»¶å»é€‚åº”æ–°åå­—ï¼Œç„¶è€Œè¿™ä¼šå’Œç°åœ¨çš„copydbä¸€æ ·æ…¢ã€‚

MongoDB Product Teamï¼ŒSep 10, 2019

é˜…è¯»åŸæ–‡
entry.summary: The â€œcopydbâ€ command is deprecated, please use these two commands instead: mongodump to back up data mongorestore to recover data from mongodump into a new namespace

entry.title: C++ explicitã€#pragma once
entry.content:
C++ explicit å…³é”®å­—

éšå¼ç±»å‹è½¬æ¢

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

class Point {
public:
    int x, y;
    Point(int x = 0, int y = 0)
        : x(x), y(y) {}
};

void displayPoint(const Point& p) 
{
    cout << "(" << p.x << "," 
         << p.y << ")" << endl;
}

int main()
{
    displayPoint(1); //éšå¼è°ƒç”¨æ„é€ å‡½æ•°
    Point p = 1;  //éšå¼è°ƒç”¨æ„é€ å‡½æ•°ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯operator=
}

explicitå…³é”®å­—

æŒ‡å®šæ„é€ å‡½æ•°æˆ–è½¬æ¢å‡½æ•° (C++11èµ·)ä¸ºæ˜¾å¼ï¼Œå³å®ƒä¸èƒ½ç”¨äºéšå¼è½¬æ¢å’Œå¤åˆ¶åˆå§‹åŒ–ã€‚

C++ #pragma once ä¸ #ifndef è§£æ

ä¸ºäº†é¿å…åŒä¸€ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶è¢«includeå¤šæ¬¡ï¼ŒC/C++ä¸­æœ‰ä¸¤ç§æ–¹å¼ï¼š

#ifndef

#ifndef SOMEFILE_H
#define SOMEFILE_H
// å£°æ˜ã€å®šä¹‰è¯­å¥...
#endif

#### #pragma once

#pragma once
// å£°æ˜ã€å®šä¹‰è¯­å¥...

é˜…è¯»åŸæ–‡
